verses.text: My beloved is gone down to his garden,
I am my belovedâ€™s, and my beloved is mine:
Thou art fair, O my love, as Tirzah,
Turn away thine eyes from me,
Thy teeth are like a flock of ewes,
Thy temples are like a piece of a pomegranate
There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines,
My dove, my undefiled, is but one;
Who is she that looketh forth as the morning,
I went down into the garden of nuts,
Before I was aware, my soul set me
